- The emerging literature on the relationship between population density and the spread of COVID-19 is reviewed.

- It is argued that reproducibility in this literature remains an elusive goal. 

- Analysis of population density and basic reproductive number shows that density is not destiny.

- The reanalysis and reappraisal of the conclusions demonstrates the importance of reproducible research.

- The paper is an example of a reproducible research project
